website_summaries.verdict: The Wilton 22036 20 Pound Head, 36-Inch BASH Sledge Hammer is powerful enough for any demolition job, but is probably better suited for professionals because of its high retail price. Very safe, with a lanyard hole for attachments.
pros: Heavy 20 pound head reduces number of strikes needed for breakage
Steel core prevents damage from overstrikes
cons: Hammer head may be too heavy for common household demolition jobs
Handle is damage-resistant, but not unbreakable

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line is if you can pick up a 20lb sledge get this one with the 36 in handle because it’s built like a tank durability wise and hits just as hard ...
customer_reviews.text: First off it is imperative that you be physically strong to wield this hammer. I’m an avid weightlifter and this hammers definitely not for the average guy. That aside, anything that connects with the force of this hammer and your swing will be obliterated by the 20lb titan sized head. Bottom line is if you can pick up a 20lb sledge get this one with the 36 in handle because it’s built like a tank durability wise and hits just as hard and the 20lb head will obliterate anything on the first hit. This hammer will probably be around after I’ve passed away.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: What a BEAST
customer_reviews.text: What a monster, I think I will be nicknaming it Hulk. I’m a modest 6’2” 225lb fella and know my way around a gym. That being said I have never swung a 20lb hammer. The construction looks and fells superior and I did lots of research before I shelled out this about of money for some iron on a stick. I am glad I did, I expect this to be a lifetime purchase. Do some homework first but I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Franklin

customer_reviews.title: No better hammer for working out with!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for workouts on a worn out tractor tire. It is built super tough. You can't go wrong with Wilton. I would not hesitate to use it to split stumps with a splitting tool, provided you can can handle the weight of it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T.

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loves it
customer_reviews.text: Hubby had a sledge hammer for decades that he thought was 20 lbs. Apparently it wasn't. When he compared his old one to the new hammer, he was very impressed. He's been using it at work ever since. He runs a construction company and needs to use tools like this often.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Best
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. The head is large, heavy (20 lbs), and painted bright green for enhanced viability. THe head has a nice flat top to stay standing up on its own. I have been wrecking anything and everything with it. It is the perfect fit for working out by pounding tires. The grip is solid and comfortable. The shaft is very durable and solidly anchored to the head. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Prone

customer_reviews.title: Used it twice to drive T-posts - what a difference ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it twice to drive T-posts - what a difference 4 pounds makes driving the posts down. Be in shape - this baby gets heavy in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: Best hammer!
customer_reviews.text: You just can't go wrong with Wilton. The only complaint I have is that the price is high and that the face of the hammer could be a little bigger to give you more surface area to hit your target.
customer_reviews.author: Leotex

customer_reviews.title: A great workout addition
customer_reviews.text: A 100% grown man's sledgehammer that will add strength and powerful explosion to tire workouts. Your strength will be enhanced along with a strong feeling of power in your upper body after hitting a tractor tire with this sledgehammer. A worthy purchase for certain.
customer_reviews.author: George E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: 1 heck of a work out. If u can't ...
customer_reviews.text: 1 heck of a work out. If u can't get it loose with this then its not suppose to be apart.
customer_reviews.author: Ace N

customer_reviews.title: This WILTON line of hammers is best of best
customer_reviews.text: Have 1-2-3drawers of misc. Hammers for my fabrication trade. . This WILTON line of hammers is best of best. This 20 lb. Even straightened bent forklift forks bent almost straight down 8" from the end, your strong arm with this 20 lb. Head ..... things will move! !
customer_reviews.author: Jami Bushman

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a hammer
customer_reviews.text: Third hammer I bought of this brand. Indestructible. 20 lb one is great for "convincing" things to do what I want.
customer_reviews.author: Tony H

customer_reviews.title: A materialized Mjolnir!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get this for a steal but even if I had to pay full price I would've and still will. This thing is a beast and no amount of over strike is breaking it!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jordan

customer_reviews.title: but so far it seems to be a good addition to my set of demo tools
customer_reviews.text: Beast of a tool. I don't know if it's worth the price yet, but so far it seems to be a good addition to my set of demo tools
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beast!  Workout!
customer_reviews.text: I work at a komatsu dealership and I have to beat pins and bushings in, alot of people use this hammer when they cant get it with a 12 lbs. Also you get 10 to 12 swings and your worn out!
customer_reviews.author: TY

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: perfect and heavy, exactly what I needed. Handle is durable and once you get used to the weight, it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a sledge hammer
customer_reviews.text: Thing is a beast. Moves objects that don’t want to move. If anyone is gonna break it I will. Still holding up strong though.
customer_reviews.author: zechariah tannehill

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I had to break up a footer and two 16X8x8 pillars. This did it. I was able to swing it about 3 or 4 times and had to stop to catch my breath. I felt no vibration in the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hoptak

customer_reviews.title: You need to be a very big guy to pick this up and hold above your head
customer_reviews.text: Smash it up destroy and kill it is a massive quality 20 pound in weight sledge hammer. If you can pick it up or let alone strong enough to lift it above your head and able to bring it down on to any thing. it will totally descintergrate what ever it makes contact with. Unless your name is King Kong I don't think you able to us this. Ps I forgot to say this is a very good quality and the best you can buy and last for ever.to be honest any thing over 12 pounds is far too heavy for most people to use properly
customer_reviews.author: Sweet fun

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Excellent quality. Real time saver. Great workout
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sledge hammer
customer_reviews.text: It's large, sturdy, heavy, powerfully built, etc. I do not see myself having to replace this thing, ever. It is a solid piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher D. Kufit

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you need to hammer something really hard or you are just looking for something to exercise with in your back yard this the the sledge hammer you want. It is heavy and will take some getting used to but once you do you will be very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: ABuilder

customer_reviews.title: WORTH THE MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to use in workouts. Pretty much hit it against some walls and tires. Amazing grip and design perfect weight. Have had regular sledge hammers in the past that have snapped on me but not this one. It is truly one of kind. It can take a beating , do not be afraid to use it.
customer_reviews.author: CR8SH

customer_reviews.title: Beast
customer_reviews.text: Great hammer less swinging using this heavy brute? If you're looking for a nice heavy ledge here's our choice. Buy one before they go up in price
customer_reviews.author: chad e bundy

customer_reviews.title: I love the size and how heavy it is
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and how heavy it is, really wish they made a bigger one! My handle broke so hopefully they will honor the warranty! If they do I would give it 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it is heavy and rugged. But I ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is heavy and rugged. But I get nauseated just being near it. The chemicals used in manufacturing are nauseating. I wish I hadn't bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Redbrickhouse

customer_reviews.title: hulk smash
customer_reviews.text: Pulled an " office space" on a work printer.. performed flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hammer!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure the unbreakable handle is worth all the money, but it is definitely an awesome tool. Or, in my case, workout toy. The guys at my fire department are envious.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Allsbury

product_meta.title: Wilton - 20 Lb Head, 36" B.A.S.H Sledge Hammer (22036)
product_meta.description:
We see a future built on great brands, great products and great people. In every facet of our business we leverage the strengths of our global infrastructure to maximize the benefits of all three.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
At Wilton, we are on a never-ending journey to create the highest quality, most indestructible tools on the market. On this journey we've managed to design and file patents for the world's most durable sledge hammer with Unbreakable Technology, revolutionary design, and engineered no-slip rubber grip. With the Wilton BASH backed by our $1,000 Guarantee, we put our money where our mouth is.
